with a population of about 90,000. It is a relatively new area, originally developed in the 1960s and much expanded since. Many technology firms are headquartered in Kanata, including Mitel.

Ottawa is not a separate capital region like the

but there is a National Capital Commission (NCC), federally funded, which does various things in the city and region. One of the NCC's projects was a "green belt" around Ottawa; they expropriated a band about ten miles wide around the city, reforested parts of it and rented other parts back to farmers. Kanata was the first major development outside that belt, a planned community that won some design awards.

In 2001, anything and everything within the Ottawa-Carleton county line (including Kanata,
) was merged into Ottawa despite some local opposition.

Airport.

A taxi from Ottawa airport to Kanata will be expensive since it is quite a long way (southern extreme of the city to the extreme west). Bus connections are good; the #97 goes downtown from the airport and #96 goes to Kanata from downtown. The two routes overlap all the way from Hurdman station (east of downtown) to Lincoln Fields station (well to the west); you can transfer anywhere between those.
417 goes right through Kanata and connects it to the rest of Ottawa.  Major exits include March Road, Kanata Avenue, and Terry Fox.

OC Transpo (the Ottawa/Carleton bus system) runs in Kanata. Routes 96 (via the transitway, then Richmond Road) and 118 (from Hurdman, along Baseline & through Bells Corners) are two of the main lines from central Ottawa.
Kanata is a very beautiful area. Kanata is very green with tons of trees, and it is also the most hi-tech and new area of Ottawa.

- Experience the ultimate in wellness at one of the most unique spas in Ottawa.

The Canadian Tire Centre - The home of the Ottawa Senators hockey team.

There are also many bike paths if you want to go walking, biking, or jogging.
The Centrum has large retail stores like Wal-Mart, Best Buy, Future Shop, Chapters, Golf Town, and Sport Chek.
There are many restaurants in Kanata.

value: offers the very best in fine dining featuring Executive Chef Michael Blackie's innovative culinary creations where exciting flavours of the Orient meet top-quality regional ingredients in an expression of contemporary Canadian cuisine.
Ironstone Grill at the Marshes - The exposed post-and-beam construction, magnificent stonework, rugged fireplace and unique fence-wall combine to create a rich, warm and relaxing atmosphere.

There are also many restaurants in the Centrum and all over Kanata.

The area code is 613, along with the rest of Ottawa.

Kanata is a fairly safe area and you shouldn't have too much trouble with crime here. The Emergency number is 911.

It might be a good idea to avoid certain parts of Glen Cairn after dark on weekends. And take care in the Kanata Centrum on Friday and Saturday nights.
